result.execSummary:
The defendant Marc A Lindgren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation is concurrent on Ct 1 and Ct 2 as are the conditions thereof unless otherwise specified.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay costs, fines, surcharges or fees directly to and will be collected by the Clark County Clerk of Court. Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions. Defendant granted a payment plan of $100.00 per month to begin 10/01/2022.
The defendant is to submit to an Alcohol and Other Drug Assessment (AODA) and follow the recommendations, releasing the findings to the agent.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety. The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent. 
Defendant is to write a two page report approved by the probation agent researching the effect on children who witness intimate partner violence(IPV).  Defendant is to attend a class on parenting teenagers.  Defendant is to write apology letters approved by the agent to both adult and child victims that articulates an understanding of the effect of IPV on the intimate partner and the child who witnesses it.
Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request

timeConds.notes: Jail sentence is on Ct 1 only.  Jail sentence is stayed pending further court order.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marc A Lindgren

records.addlTxt: 9:59 AM Defendant Marc A Lindgren in court.  Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee in court for Marc A Lindgren.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Waived reading of Information  An agreement has been reached.  Waived reading of the amended Information.  The defendant enters a plea of No Contest  The Court finds that the defendant has entered their plea, knowingly, intelligently and of their own free will and finds the defendant Guilty. State is in compliance with Victim Rights Law.

04:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Melissa S. Inlow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marc A Lindgren in court.  Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee in court for Marc A Lindgren. 
Defense filed a preliminary hearing waiver. Court goes through full colloquy of waiver for preliminary hearing with Defendant. Court finds probable cause and bounds over for trial. Defense moves to schedule arraignment and plea/sentencing.
Arraignment scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Marc A Lindgren
Current: 115 N Union St, Loyal, WI 54446   (Effective: 04-08-2022)
Prior: 111 N Union St, Loyal, WI 54446
Preliminary hearing on July 13, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

09:44 AM Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared on behalf of the State and Defendant, Marc A Lindgren, appeared with Attorney Mandy Lynn Caffee, appeared by video.   Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint. Waived reading of the complaint     Waived time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Request to modify bond.  No objection from the State.  Court grants.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
